abstract: A Japanese bank’s bold run ended, the creator of Citigroup called for an end to megabanks, the New York Fed faced more questions and China made a $15 billion oil bid. A look back on our reporting of the last week’s highs and lows in finance.
snippet: A Japanese bank’s bold run ended, the creator of Citigroup called for an end to megabanks, the New York Fed faced more questions and China made a $15 billion oil bid. A look back on our reporting of the last week’s highs and lows in finance.
lead_paragraph: A Japanese bank’s bold run ended, the creator of Citigroup called for an end to megabanks, the New York Fed faced more questions and China made a $15 billion oil bid. A look back on our reporting of the last week’s highs and lows in finance.

headline.main: Week in Review: A Deal Maker’s Doubts
